content: Subzone of Museum Planning Area in Singapore **Bras Basah** (/ˈbrɑːs ˌbɑːsɑː/, [Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 百胜, [Tamil](/wiki/Tamil_language): பிராஸ் பாசா) is a district located in the [Museum Planning Area](/wiki/Museum_Planning_Area) of the [Central Area](/wiki/Central_Area,_Singapore) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Bras Basah ([Modern Spelling](/wiki/New_Rumi_Spelling): Beras Basah) means "wet rice" in [Malay](/wiki/Malay_language) – *beras* means harvested rice with [husk](/wiki/Husk) removed, and *basah* means wet. The arts and heritage district in Singapore's civic centre, precinct houses several landmarks including [Fairmont Singapore](/wiki/Fairmont_Singapore), [Raffles Hotel](/wiki/Raffles_Hotel), the [Singapore Art Museum](/wiki/Singapore_Art_Museum), the [Cathedral of the Good Shepherd](/wiki/Cathedral_of_the_Good_Shepherd) and [Singapore Management University](/wiki/Singapore_Management_University). [School of the Arts, Singapore (SOTA)](/wiki/School_of_the_Arts,_Singapore), Singapore's first specialised pre-tertiary art school, is also situated here. It was awarded Best Learning Building at the [World Architecture Festival](/wiki/World_Architecture_Festival) in 2010. [Bras Basah MRT station](/wiki/Bras_Basah_MRT_station), a [Mass Rapid Transit](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) (MRT) station on the [Circle line (CCL)](/wiki/Circle_Line_(Singapore)), was awarded the "Best Transport Building" at the [World Architecture Festival](/wiki/World_Architecture_Festival) in 2009. Both the station and SOTA were designed by [WOHA](/wiki/WOHA), a local firm. [LASALLE College of the Arts](/wiki/Lasalle_College_of_the_Arts) and [Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA)](/wiki/Nanyang_Academy_of_Fine_Arts), which together make up the [University of the Arts](/wiki/University_of_the_Arts_Singapore), are also situated here. There are also numerous religious buildings throughout the area, including the [Catholic](/wiki/Catholic_Church) [Church of Saints Peter & Paul](/wiki/Church_of_Saints_Peter_and_Paul,_Singapore) and the [Jewish](/wiki/Jews) [Maghain Aboth Synagogue](/wiki/Maghain_Aboth_Synagogue) across from each other and the [Buddhist](/wiki/Buddhism) [Kwan Im Thong Hood Cho Temple](/wiki/Kwan_Im_Thong_Hood_Cho_Temple) and the [Hindu](/wiki/Hinduism) [Sri Krishnan Temple](/wiki/Sri_Krishnan_Temple) beside each other. 1°17′49″N 103°51′11″E﻿ / ﻿1.297°N 103.853°E﻿ / 1.297; 103.853 This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub.
